title: How Sri Lanka can weather the US tariff storm
byline: As the United States imposes sweeping reciprocal tariffs around the world, Sri Lanka finds itself in especially dire straits. The staggering 44% tariff rate, the sixth highest globally, poses a direct threat to Sri Lanka’s US-dependent export market, potentially leading to steep job losses and economic instability at a time when the country is struggling to recover from a 2022 financial crisis.

title: Air quality good in several cities, moderate elsewhere
byline: Good levels of air quality were recorded in Kandy, Kegalle, Trincomalee, Mullaitivu, Batticaloa, Kalutara, Hambantota, Polonnaruwa and Moneragala, while moderate levels were recorded in most of the other cities.

title: Finance companies record Rs.277bn credit expansion in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka’s banks and finance companies ended 2024 on a strong note, disbursing a substantial volume of loans to the private sector as declining interest rates and a recovering economy reignited credit demand.

title: BOI targets 3Q25 to start construction at Northern investment zones
byline: The Board of Investment (BOI) said yesterday that efforts are underway to accelerate the initial steps needed to ensure infrastructure facilities are in place at the proposed investment zones in Kankesanthurai, Paranthan, and Mankulam, aiming for investors to begin construction by the end of the third quarter.

title: 'Pilleyan' arrested
byline: Former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, alias ‘Pilleyan’, was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago, police said.

title: Extinct dire wolf species returns after 12,500 years
byline: A species of wolf that died out some 12,500 years ago lives again as the “world’s first successfully de-extincted animal,” according to Dallas-based biotech company Colossal Biosciences.

title: Committee to be appointed to look into repealing of PTA
byline: A  Cabinet Paper has been presented to appoint a committee to look into repealing the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Large scale inclusive and exclusive errors in Aswesuma
byline: There are high inclusive and exclusive errors in the Aswesuma scheme as many who are eligible are not included as recipients while a large number of people who are not eligible have been included as recipients, Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF) Harsha de Silva told Parliament today.

title: Namal meets Modi
byline: After attending the ’Rising Bharat Summit 2025’ in New Delhi, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi yesterday.

title: Grade 6 admissions appeal deadline extended to April 30
byline: The deadline for submission of appeals regarding admission to Grade 6 in 2025, based on the results of the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, has been extended till April 30, the Education Ministry announced.

title: Tariffs on China set to rise to at least 104% on Wednesday, White House says
byline: President Donald Trump is set to impose an astounding 104% in levies across all Chinese imports on Wednesday, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt announced on Tuesday. This comes on top of Chinese tariffs that were in place prior to Trump’s second term.

title: Dominican Republic nightclub collapse kills 79
byline: At least 79 people have been killed and more than 150 injured after a roof collapsed at a nightclub in the Dominican Republic’s capital Santo Domingo, officials have said.

title: Former Kataragama PS Chairman arrested for forging document
byline: Former Kataragama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Ashoka Wickramasinghe has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Employees hold garment head hostage over bonus issue
byline: A tense situation was reported at a garment factory in Weligama, Matara, last night when a group of employees protested by placing the company’s head under house arrest over the denial of their annual bonus allowance.

title: State officials also involved in corruption: Outgoing AG
byline: Outgoing Auditor General Chulantha Wickramaratne has revealed that several corruption investigations have uncovered the involvement of state officials.

title: US reciprocal tax will create political upheavals, will end globalisation: RW
byline: Highlighting that there is a strong possibility of political upheavals   due to the deteriorating economic situation brought on by the US reciprocal tax and that it will end globalisation, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government should take several remedial actions.

title: Tourism Ministry targets USD 200 daily expenditure per tourist
byline: While increasing attractive tourist engagement activities and developing facilities at tourist locations, the Ministry is aiming to raise the average daily expenditure of a tourist in the country to USD 200, Chairman of both the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) and the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau (SLTPB) Buddhika Hewawasam said.

title: Relief period on Parate executions for SMEs extended
byline: The Ministry of Finance announced an extension of the relief period on Parate executions for Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), as part of the government’s ongoing efforts to support the revival of the sector.

title: Toddler died in agony after being bitten by fire ants
byline: An adorable two-year-old died after she endured an agonizing allergic reaction to fire ants, and now her parents have filed a lawsuit alleging that the hospital staff could’ve prevented their child’s tragic death.

title: Dominican Republic nightclub collapse kills 79
byline: At least 79 people have been killed and more than 150 injured after a roof collapsed at a nightclub in the Dominican Republic’s capital Santo Domingo, officials have said.

title: Mervyn Silva further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva and three other suspects have been further remanded until April 21 by the Mahara Magistrate’s Court.

title: RW funded Maithri’s 2015 Presidential campaign: SJB MP
byline: SJB MP Jagath Vithana alleged in Parliament that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe funded Maithripala Sirisena’s 2015 Presidential campaign—on the condition that Arjuna Mahendran be appointed Central Bank Governor.

title: Peeping-tom arrested for watching sleeping women
byline: A peeping-tom in the habit of entering houses at the dead of night and watching women asleep, was arrested by the Haliela police in the early hours of last morning.

title: EC confirms Samantha Ranasinghe for vacant NPP seat in Parliament
byline: The Election Commission officially announced the approval of Samantha Ranasinghe’s name to fill the vacant Parliamentary seat for the Kegalle District, following the demise of National People’s Power (NPP) MP Kosala Nuwan Jayaweera.

title: More buses to operate for New Year travel demand: LPBOA
byline: Nearly 1,000 buses will be deployed to meet the passenger demand during the New Year season, Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) Chairman Gemunu Wijerathne said.

title: President to meet all party leaders tomorrow
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will meet all party leaders tomorrow at the Presidential Sectatariat to discuss the impact of the unusual US tariffs on Sri Lankan exports.

title: Firecrackers lit in Batticaloa to celebrate Pillayan’s arrest
byline: People in Batticaloa town lit firecrackers yesterday to express their happiness over the arrest of Tamil Makkal Viduthalai Pulikal (TMVP) leader and former Eastern Province Chief Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, also known as Pillayan.

title: Sathsara Nimesh’s body to be exhumed for postmortem
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Kemintha Perera today ordered the exhumation of the body of Sathsara Nimesh, who died while in the custody of the Welikada Police, to conduct a fresh postmortem examination by a three-member panel of medical experts.

title: Nursing home fire in China kills 20 people
byline: Twenty people have been killed in a fire at a nursing home in north-east China, state media report.

title: Probe on apparel company refusing to pay bonus using reciprocal tax as excuse
byline: A probe is being carried out on an apparel company in Weligama which has refused to pay bonus to its employees by using the US Reciprocal tariff as an excuse, Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe told Parliament today.

title: Mid-term school holiday on Friday
byline: The second phase of the first school term will end on Friday (11), the Education Ministry announced.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella arrives at CID
byline: Former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to give a statement.

title: VAT Amendment Bill approved by Parliament
byline: The Value Added Tax (VAT) Amendment Bill which seeks to rectify certain shortcomings of the VAT was unanimously approved by Parliament today.

title: President warns of removing state officials if they continue to resist change after May
byline: Claiming that no section of the public service has been allowed to collapse over the past six months of the present government, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said if officials continue to resist change, the government will proceed to remove and replace them after May.

title: 36 vendors face legal action for violating CAA Act
byline: Officers attached to the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) have taken legal action against 36 vendors found to be conducting sales in violation of the CAA Act.

title: China announces 84% retaliatory tariffs on US goods in showdown with Trump
byline: China unveiled retaliatory tariffs of 84% on imports of US goods on Wednesday, matching additional tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump and further inflaming a trade war between the world’s two biggest economies.

title: CSE Plunges on global trade war fears as Trump announces 104% China tariffs
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) suffered heavy losses Thursday as investors fled risky assets following former U.S. President Donald Trump’s shock announcement of 104 percent tariffs on Chinese imports, reigniting fears of a full-blown global trade war.

title: Trump announces ’90 day pause’ on tariffs for most countries, ups levies on China
byline: US stocks ripped higher on Wednesday as President Trump announced a 90-day pause on tariffs.

title: Govt. to conduct another round of animal census
byline: Agriculture Minister K. D. Lal Kantha said the government was expecting to conduct another round of animal census as the previous census could not be considered completely accurate.

title: Sajith meets Juile Chung
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa met US Ambassador in Sri Lanka Juile Chung today and discussed trade between the two countries.

title: Calypso train earns Rs. 720,000 on day of launch
byline: The launch of the ’’Calypso’’ train service, featuring special open-air viewing facilities between Nanu Oya and Demodara, earned Rs. 720,000 on its first day, Railways Additional General Manager Operations Vajira Polwattage said.

title: Bay of Bengal low-pressure area moving north
byline: The low-pressure area in the central parts of the south-west Bay of Bengal is likely to move northwards over the west-central Bay of Bengal during the next 12 hours, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Ranil would have negotiated tariff reduction with Elon Musk: Rajitha
byline: Former Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne claimed that if someone like President Ranil Wickremesinghe were currently in government, he would have directly engaged with Elon Musk, Senior Advisor to the U.S. President, to negotiate a reduction of the 44% tariff imposed on Sri Lankan goods.
